meta_data.title: Our Time on Patience Has Run Out
meta_data.subtitle: Galatians 5:22-23 Thanks to everyone who supports TMBH at  You're the reason we can all do this together!  Music by

transcription_data.text: the name of friends that's the ten minute by the lower podcast as we discussed yesterday the bad news here is that my workshed got struck by lightning broke my internet the good news is that my workshed did not gain consciousness as a result and go on a destructive rampage like the plot of the two thousand five smash hit stealth starring james fox because there's some positives here still have quite got my internet fixed have been able to get a hold of those ethernet switch people and haven't brought myself to the point of mustering the patients needed to get back on another long wait on hold with the hold music so that i can talk to them about how the lightning broke my internet speaking of patience we're talking about patience because it's one of the fruit of the spirit it's right here in collation chapter five that's a good one so good for the spirit it's a timely fruit of the spirit for me this week and had this plan when we got to the fruit of the spirit it was like i'm just going to be like these are the fruit of the spirit they're good let's just keep going rakita spend a bunch of time on this but then i got a love and that was the first one is like well we'll probably talk about what the bible means about love a lot because it seems like there's societal debate confusion about what exactly that means in particular about what it means when the bible says love so we took a real long time we did that and i was like there now it's all downhill from here we're just gonna cruise through the rest of these fruit of the spirit but then joy came up like well that one probably deserves a whole day i was pretty good peace i like peace that one deserves a whole day now is like patience well that one deserves a day but then i thought about it a little bit was like well this seems like the one where it makes sense to talk about these being the attributes of god that are transferable that are they're handed off to us in the form of the fruit of the spirit and now here we are in our third day of patience this kind of a meta thing going on there though right i mean patience it takes us three days to get through it uh... today's gonna be the last day on patience is what i know we started talking about patience from the biblical perspective as an attribute of god just definitionally logically biblically god must be patient because everything else in creation is worse than him what do we have to be patient with well one of the things that it's hard to be patient with in life is stuff that's dumber and worse than us or at least that we perceive that way can you imagine being smarter and better and gooder and writer then literally everything and having that be actually the case not just arrogance dang watch that superman trailer that's planned all the time right now if you're watching this later in history you might not remember what i'm talking about but as i'm recording this we're coming up on all of the people on the whole d c comic book movie universe they got a new superman this is like the six th or seventh one that's happened in my lifetime and i'm using looks like he's gonna do a nice job but in the the trailer that's so popular for this new fangled superman that has this new feel and hopefully is gonna be refreshing and different from previous comic book movies there's this one shot right where superman who has basically unlimited power and strength or whatever he sees it a little girl is about to get wrecked by some kind of shrapnel explosion and the dad that guy got killed i'm not even being ironic right now this works on me the dad part of me just goes this is what i think about right before i drift off to sleep every night protect protect protect all it's a little girl and that shot that james gun the director this movie is crafted that i keep seeing in this trailer is superman with all this power rushing it like the speed of light to get in between this little girl and the explosion and then he has to tuck her head down to get it be you know to cover her fully with his body so that all of the wreckage and everything will smash into him and not tear her up and if you just think about what superman is he's so strong that the amount of strength and speed he has to exert to get in position to protect her but then the amount of delicacy that he has to simultaneously demonstrate not to hurt her while trying to protect her because of his massive strength is crazy and that's one of my favorite things about superman is just that idea of someone so powerful trying to interact in society with a bunch of people who are so far beneath him in terms of power and strength says things in each shot and as i keep seeing that trailer keeps reminding me this attribute of god he's literally better than anyone else he could ever talk to he's literally better than everybody he literally knows more than everybody's more powerful than everybody okay well if that is the case if there is a god definitionally god must be patient you just hope he's really really really really patient and that seems to be what the bible demonstrates so then because god is like that and he has a long view as we've discussed it makes sense that patients with god would be the least we can do it would be the most obvious aspect of patience as a fruit of the spirit and evidence of the work of the spirit in the life of the person who's with god we talked about that yesterday but then in addition well there's going to be this element of patience it is maybe the most obvious element but that's just patience with other people and surprise i brought a bible and i have a couple of verses in mind and one of them is in first Corinthians and this is also by Paul and it's a verse i've read recently but it's it's the love one right first Corinthians 13 love is patient love is kind it does not envy it does not boast it is not proud and it goes on we read all of that the other day but patience isn't just its own individual attribute patience is an expression of love it's an expression of humility to say your thing is a mess right now or your thing is inconveniencing me but i'm going to humble myself before whatever your circumstances are and i'm going to be patient with you it's a fruit of the spirit Colossians 3 go eat pop corn just count it up there it is Colossians 3 12 through 14 right here therefore as God's chosen people holy and dearly loved clothe yourselves with compassion kindness humility gentleness and patience bear with each other and forgive what grievances you may have against one another forgive as the Lord forgave you and over all these virtues put on love which binds them all together in perfect unity and maybe right now you're like you are an incredibly lazy man and your lightning strike is no excuse for this laziness you're just going through the same list of verses you did with love like see what you're doing you caught me both of my hands are guiltily in the air on either side of this microphone right now guilty is charged also i totally make sense doesn't it that the love and the forgiveness and the patience thing they're all knitted together i mean isn't that what this passage is saying that love is kind of the cord that wraps all of these otherwise clumsy things that we might not be able to hold all at the same time it's just too big an armful but if you wrap all of these virtues up in love it works well yeah forgiveness patience long suffering we're imitating god when we are like that when we do that but also the capacity to do that is a gift from god we're mirroring him all right in general patience is regarded in the bible not just as a thing that the spiritually mature person has with god like god's working stuff out so i'm being patient long view of history patience is not just regarded in the bible is patience with others but there's also just this idea of a general virtue of sort of a long view of things of understanding that life is big and the knee jerk reaction to things isn't always the shrewd or wise reaction ecclesiastes seven eight says the end of a matter is better than its beginning and patience is better than pride huh yeah that's that's pretty simple i mean it's basically a proverb right there in ecclesiastes and speaking of proverbs i mean there's a bunch of them about patience in proverbs but i jotted down this one proverbs 14 29 a patient man has great understanding but a quick tempered man displays folly think about most of the things you most regret how many of them are tied to impatience or a quick reaction a lot of them for me a lot of the stupidest stuff that i've ever said was just quick i didn't think i didn't reflect or i didn't think about the bigger picture and so yeah patience is a fruit of the spirit and my impatience is kind of an act of the flesh okay last one we got patience with god we have patience with others we have patience as a general virtue and then finally there's this idea throughout the bible of patience in the face of suffering and we've looked at a lot of stuff that deals with that first peter tackles a bunch of that i am going to go with roman's 12 12 this is a letter that paul wrote in it he touches on the idea of suffering it's a letter that paul wrote to the christians in rome a place where paul would inevitably suffer quite a bit by that i mean they took his head off with a sword there in rome and in roman's 12 12 it says be joyful in hope patient and affliction faithful in prayer share with god's people who are in need practice hospitality the virtue throughout the entire new testament is we be patient in suffering this is part of the deal of this lifetime and this world and the nature of the world this is why things need to be redeemed this is why god is redeeming and so part of patience with god is also patience with suffering is also tied to patience with others is also tied to a general calm peace that passes understanding notion of patience as an orientation toward life in the unfolding of things you think about the people who you deeply admire who you want to be like who you trust they all have this virtue you think about the people who are walking chaos and you never quite know what you're going to get and they live crisis to crisis and you might really like them but eh it isn't what you want to do generally patience is not among the fruit that is on display in their lives the people we admire tend to get this really right and if i'm to understand Paul correctly here in Galatians 5 they got it from god whether they've ever said that out loud or not because patience is a virtue of god all right that's plenty for now hopefully tomorrow they got me to look out for me i could be full-internetting again in just one day i don't even know what i'm gonna do first maybe i'll go tweet some more stuff the possibilities are endless crazy all right that's plenty for now i'm at this is a 10 minute bible hour podcast let's do this again soon you
